member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.ErrorCheckResult
member.summary: Defines the states possible when checking for errors in API response. Can be either a VALID response, a response containing one, or more, ERROR conditions, or a request that needs to RETRY due to a temporary issue (currently only Rate Limit Exceeded).

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.ErrorCheckResult.VALID
member.summary: API Response contained the requested data

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.ErrorCheckResult.ERROR
member.summary: API Request produced an error, will need to check request before trying again

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.ErrorCheckResult.RETRY
member.summary: API Request did not successfully complete, will need to be retried

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError
member.summary: BrimeAPIError defines/implements the various error responses possible with an API request. Note this class does not represent a C# Exception, for that we use BrimeAPIException and its subclasses. This class is used to wrap/interpret the responses provided from the API which are then converted into the C# Exceptions users of the library should be detecting.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.Logger
member.summary: Class Logging instance.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.Name
member.summary: Error response name. This name is used to identify the specific error which has occurred, as the ErrorCode can be shared by multiple different errors.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.ErrorCode
member.summary: Error response code. This code is generally related to the associated HTTP response code which would be returned by this particular error. This code may be the default if the Name was not recognized as a known error response.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.Message
member.summary: Descriptive message provided with the error. This message may contain more specific information on the cause of the error, or what may be needed to correct it.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance, using given Name, ErrorCode and Message. Constructors for this class are private since they should only be created in response to parsing the API response JSON.
member.param: Identifying name of the error, as provided in the API response
Error code associated with this error, if known, or default if unknown error
Descriptive message provided with this error in API response

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new instance, using an empty message component.
member.param: Identifying name of the error
Status code associated with this error (may be default if unknown error)

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.CheckError(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse)
member.summary: Runs check over given API response to identify whether an error has occured with the request. Will also identify if the request needs to be retried due to temporary issues.
member.param: API response to check
member.returns: ErrorCheckResult will be VALID if no issues, RETRY if Rate limited, or ERROR for other issues

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.ThrowException(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse)
member.summary: Throws exception for the first detected error in the response.
member.param: API response to validate

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.lookupError(System.String)
member.summary: Primary public constructor for this class. Processes the given error message (which should have been supplied in the JSON response to an API request) to produce an instance of this class.
member.param: Should be in the format "NAME: Message" as provided by API response data in JSON
member.returns: Parses the contents of the given message and creates an appropriate instance of this class

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError.getErrorCode(System.String)
member.summary: Internal helper method to lookup the associated ErrorCode for a given Name
member.param: Identifying Name of the error
member.returns: ErrorCode for this name, or 418 if the name was not recognized

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIException
member.summary: Base class for exceptions generated in response to API requests. Catching this exception should catch all exceptions which may be generated by the API itself, however exceptions generated by the underlying transport will not necessarily be included.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIException.Error
member.summary: Used to define the underlying API Error which has triggered this exception.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIException.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Constructs a new Exception for the given BrimeAPIError
member.param: API Error which has triggered this

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIException.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor used when creating an Exception based on an underlying Exception. This constructor is primarily for the BrimeAPIMalformedResponse, as this is not actually an API response Error, but is triggered when the actual API response contains invalid JSON or is missing required elements in the JSON response. This exception generally indicates that the current API does not fully match the API specification in this version of the library.
member.param: API Error which has triggered this
An underlying Exception which may have caused the exception

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor used to support wrapping of transport exceptions into the API. Can be used to rethrow exceptions generated in sending/receiving API data. This is used to prevent exceptions generated by the current implementation from propagating outside this library. Wraps the base exception as an Internal Error for the API.
member.param: Existing exception which has prevented correct response to API request

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInternalError
member.summary: Represents an Internal Server error when making API request.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInternalError.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "INTERNAL_ERROR"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInvalidChannel
member.summary: Exception thrown when the API request was for a non-existent or invalid channel.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInvalidChannel.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "INVALID_CHANNEL"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInvalidClientID
member.summary: Exception thrown when the API request included an invalid Client-ID. Note that the Error will generally be a missing parameter if the Client-ID was not sent at all.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIInvalidClientID.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "INVALID_CLIENT_ID"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMalformedResponse
member.summary: Internal API Exception, thrown when the JSON response to an API request is missing required elements, or contains invalid/unparseable values for those elements. This exception generally indicates that the current API does not fully match the API specification in this version of the library.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMalformedResponse.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a new exception with only an error message.
member.param: Descriptive message for this error

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMalformedResponse.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Construct a new exception with both error message, and a base exception which triggered the error.
member.param: Descriptive message for this error
Base exception which caused the issue with processing the response

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMissingAccess.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Exception thrown when request is made which is missing required access. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "MISSING_ACCESS" which appears to be returned when request made which requires BrimeAPIRequest.RequiresSpecialAccess
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMissingParameter
member.summary: Exception thrown when API request was missing a required parameter. This will also be the exception thrown when the request failed to include a Client-ID (though if the ID was included, but not valid this will instead generate a BrimeAPIInvalidClientID).

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMissingParameter.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "MISSING_PARAMETER"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMissingScope
member.summary: Exception thrown when API request was made with an identifier that does not include the required scope for this request.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIMissingScope.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "MISSING_SCOPE"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPINotImplemented
member.summary: Exception thrown when API request was to an endpoint which is not currently implemented.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPINotImplemented.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "NOT_IMPLEMENTED"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIRateLimitExceeded
member.summary: Exception thrown when client has sent too many requests recently and has been rate limited. Indicates caller needs to wait and retry the request.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIRateLimitExceeded.#ctor(BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.errors.BrimeAPIError)
member.summary: Create a new exception. BrimeAPIError.Name should be "RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED"
member.param: API Error which triggered this exception

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIEndpoint
member.summary: Defines API interface being used.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIEndpoint.PRODUCTION
member.summary: Main Production API - current public release.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIEndpoint.STAGING
member.summary: Main Testing API - next scheduled public release.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIEndpoint.SANDBOX
member.summary: Sandbox Testing API

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeRequestMode
member.summary: Used to specify the request mode - default is normally GET.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeRequestMode.GET
member.summary: Request is expected to return API response data, default request mode

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeRequestMode.POST
member.summary: Request is expected to trigger on server, normally no response data. (ie Used when using API to create clip on channel.)

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1
member.summary: Base class used to define a specific API request. This class contains the normal structures required to implement the request to the platform (ie Client-ID, API base endpoint, etc) and will be responsible for managing rate-limiting requests. (TODO)
member.typeparam: Defines the detail class used for the response to this request

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.Logger
member.summary: Class Logger instance

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.APIEndpoint
member.summary: Specifies the specific API endpoint to use in this request. Currently defaults to STAGING, will be updated to PRODUCTION once this version of the API is finalized.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.ClientID
member.summary: Specifies the Client-ID sent with requests to the API. Note that in order to use this library you will need to have a valid Client-ID assigned. This field is static so will only need to be specified once.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.RequiresSpecialAccess
member.summary: Specifies whether this request requires special access on the Client-ID in order to complete successfully. Currently this is required for User-details requests.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.getResponse
member.summary: Create a custom object from the request.
member.example:
Normal implementation: BrimeAPIResponse response = doRequest(); // Process request and generate response.
BrimeAPIError.ThrowException(response); // Trigger any exceptions generated by the request.
return new ResponseType(response.Data); // Construct the custom object for this type of request.
member.returns: Custom object based on the type of information requested.
member.exception: Request is missing a required parameter
Request ID was missing the required scope for this endpoint
Too many requests have been issued recently
An error not currently recognised by this API implementation was returned

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.RequestFormat
member.summary: Request format for this particular request. This is set by the specific implementing class to define the path to the specific endpoint, and will include placeholders to be replaced by using

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.GetRequestParameters
member.summary: Defines the delegate structure used to specify the string parameters. Delegate is used to ensure that the parameters are retrieved at the moment of the request, allowing them to be changed between creation of the request and the actual call, or between multiple invokations of a particular call. Particularly used for requests which allow paging through results - same request can just be updated to skip the appropriate number of items and be re-triggered without other modification.
member.returns: an array of string entries to be used to fill the placeholders in

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.RequestParameters
member.summary: Parameters to be included in the API request. This is set by the specific implementing class as a function which will select the correct set of parameters when the request is triggered. Default implementation is for requests which require no parameters.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.RequestMode
member.summary: Specify the mode to use for this API request. Default is GET, but can also be set to POST request.

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.GetPostBody
member.summary: Defines the delegate structure used to specify a post body for a request.
member.returns: string to be used for the post body in a POST request

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.PostBody
member.summary: Used only with POST requests to specify the body of the request to send. Default just returns an empty string.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new API request. Used directly when needing to include requiresSpecialAccess=true.
member.param: used to set RequestFormat
true if this request requires special API access, false for most requests

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Normal constructor, will call other constructor defaulting requiresSpecialAccess=false
member.param: used to set RequestFormat

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.getAPIEndpoint
member.summary: Helper method to retrieve the correct API endpoint base.
member.returns: base website address for the currently selected API Endpoint

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.composeRequest
member.summary: Helper method to construct the full API URL. Takes getAPIEndpoint and appends RequestFormat, correctly replacing placeholders with RequestParameters.
member.returns: URL string for the full address specified in this API request

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIRequest`1.doRequest
member.summary: Helper method to trigger this API request. This central method is used to actually perform the request to the endpoint, and process the response. This method is centralized to allow easy activation of rate-limiting of the service. Note this method should not trigger any exceptions due to errors in the response data.
member.returns: API response created as a result of this request

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse
member.summary: Response to API request. Provides access to API Notice information and any errors generated by the request.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse.Logger
member.summary: Local NLog logging class.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse.Data
member.summary: Contains the JSON response for the request.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse.Errors
member.summary: List of BrimeAPIError entries returned by the request.

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse.__Notice
member.summary: Contains API Notice returned by the request. As per the API v1 specification: The __notice field will only be present when there is a notice, this will be used to notify you of upcoming Api changes. You should implement an alert system internally to notify you when this field is present.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeAPIResponse.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for API Response. Decodes any JSON response data, and identifies any error or notice components.
member.param: JSON data returned by the API request.
member.exception: Thrown only if there is an issue processing the API Error response.

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.categories.CategoryRequest
member.summary: Gets information for a specific category.

member.name: F:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.categories.CategoryRequest.GET_CATEGORY_REQUEST
member.summary: [API]/v1/category/:category

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.categories.CategoryRequest.Category
member.summary: Specify the Category to request by either Name, ID, or Slug.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.categories.CategoryRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: CategoryRequest constructor. Requires parameter specifying the category to get information from.
member.param: The category name, id, or slug.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.categories.CategoryRequest.getResponse
member.summary: Generate BrimeCategory from API response.
member.returns: BrimeCategory for the requested category name/id/slug.
member.exception: If there is an error in the returned Category.

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.JSONUtil
member.summary: Helper class for performing conversions to JSON.

member.summary: Convert the given array of string items into a JSON array element. Ensures that the items are correctly converted to JSON strings as they are included.

member.returns: JSON array of provided string entries

member.summary:
Convert the given list of string items into JSON array element.

member.param: list of items to convert to JSON array of strings
member.returns: JSON array of provided string entries

member.summary: Convert the given item into a new JSON entry. Assumes the value is already a valid JSON item.
member.param: JSON body for the entry
name for the entry
member.returns: "name": value

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.JSONUtil.ToJSONEntry(System.String[])
member.summary: Collects the given set of items into a new composite entity. Assumes the items in the list are already valid JSON entries.
member.param: array of JSON items
member.returns: { item[0], item[1],... item[n] }

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.JSONUtil.TOJSONEntry(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Collects the given set of items into a new composite entity. Assumes the items in the list are already valid JSON entries.
member.param: list of JSON items
member.returns: { item[0], item[1],... item[n] }

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.JSONUtil.MakeJSONArray(System.String[])
member.summary: Collect given set of items into an array. Assumes the items in the array are already valid JSON entries.

member.returns: [ item[0], item[1],... item[n] ]

member.summary:
Wrapper to ToString(string[]) - will convert calls to this over to this method then move body to this method and remove.

Maximum number of requests available per timeout period
Number of milliseconds before thread counts reset

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.RateLimitedRequestHandler.doRequest(System.String,BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.BrimeRequestMode,System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Perform the given API request, using the given parameters. This method will wait to ensure that no more then 5 requests are issued per second as per rate limit in API spec.

request mode (either GET or POST)
data to use for POST request, generally empty string
member.returns: processed response to API request

member.param: JSON data to process

summary.para: Class BrimeVODStreamInfo is used to record the stream information assocated with a VOD record. This item records the Stream Title and Stream Category used when the original stream was broadcast.

member.name: T:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest
member.summary: Requests a range of VODs for a particular channel

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.ChannelName
member.summary: Specify the Channel the VODs are associated with

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.Limit
member.summary: Identify how many VODs to return for this request. Default is 50

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.Skip
member.summary: Specify how many VODs to skip before selecting the set to return. Allows paging through the list of VODs. TODO: Identify whether Skip is counted in individual VODs or in multiples of Limit

member.name: P:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.Sort
member.summary: Defines the order to sort the VODs before selecting the set to return. With DESC default, will return the latest 50 VODs, while if set to ASC, will return the oldest 50 VODs.

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of this request, for the specified channel.
member.param: Specify the Channel to request VODs from

member.name: M:BrimeAPI.com.brimelive.api.vods.ChannelVodsRequest.getResponse
member.summary: Retrieve the list of VODs for this request.
member.returns: List of BrimeVOD entries, between 0 and Limit items
